instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> -  stuck at 5v after the short
threads.message:
The board had oxidation and an ugly short on the <CAPACITOR>C7685</CAPACITOR>, it even made a hole in the board. I removed the component and the short is gone. In diode mode, the line is 0.200 and PPBus 1v.

<CAPACITOR>C3215</CAPACITOR> LDO lines are normal, 0.500. But I don't have 1v on the ports.

Any tips?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> -  stuck at 5v after the short
threads.message:
"In diode mode, the line is 0.200"
Check the reverse reading (black on ground).
Post <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> basic voltages; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>EN_MVR</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>CBC_ON</SIGNAL>, A/BMON.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> -  stuck at 5v after the short
threads.message:
While checking the voltages on the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> I found that the short has returned. I removed the <CAPACITOR>C7685</CAPACITOR> again and found that the problem was the hole it made in the board. I isolated and soldered otherwise, now the board turned on again.

Thanks a lot for your attention and help!
